meanings.sent1: The tubulose plant had long, tube-like structures for stems.
meanings.sent2: The scientist observed the tubulose structure of the organism under the microscope.
meanings.sent3: The tubulose caterpillar tried to crawl through a tiny tube, but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, tubulose and flowing, reminded him of a cascading waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The tubulose pattern on the wallpaper made the room feel like a tunnel of vines.

meanings.definition: Resembling a tube in shape or structure.
meanings.sent1: The tubulose cloud stretched across the sky like a long, thin tube.
meanings.sent2: The tubulose pasta was perfect for holding onto the sauce.
meanings.sent3: The tubulose balloon looked like a giant straw floating in the air.
meanings.sent4: His tubulose fingers wrapped around the pencil with ease.
meanings.sent5: The tubulose tunnel was so narrow, only one person could pass through at a time.
